page.title: 19CONSERVATION IN BRIDGEND.
page.content: Litchard Junior School,Bridgend Railway Station and Newcastle Hill Square have all won Prince of Wales Awards for improving the environment. Litchard Junior School received their award in 1980 for the school's Nature Reserve.The project began in 1970 with the purchase of a piece of land adjacent to the school playing fields. Rubbish was cleared from the area but no clearance of the land took place as it was decided to use the natural features present.Deciduous trees and conifers were planted,a pond and ditch dug.Careful planning ensured the reserve was aesthetically pleasant as well as a useful outdoor classroom. This reserve also received a Shell Better Britain Award in 1980,coming 1st.in Wales and 2nd.in Great Britain. The Station and Square received theirs retaining character while modernising.
